summary: Frontend testing of CMS role-based access completed successfully. All features working as expected. Super Admin sees 6 tabs (Home, Medical Care, Transport, About, Header, Footer) with lock icons on Header/Footer. Admin sees only 4 tabs (Home, Medical Care, Transport, About) - Header and Footer are correctly hidden. Purple notice banner appears for Super Admin when viewing Header/Footer sections.
passed_tests: Super Admin sees all 6 CMS tabs: Home, Medical Care, Transport, About, Header, Footer
Super Admin Header tab has lock icon
Super Admin Footer tab has lock icon
Purple notice banner appears when Super Admin views Header section
Purple notice banner appears when Super Admin views Footer section
Super Admin can see Home page content (4 items: hero, services-title, cta, emergency-phone)
Super Admin can see Header content (2 items: logo, emergency-banner)
Super Admin can see Footer content (4 items: company-info, phone, legal, copyright)
Admin sees only 4 CMS tabs: Home, Medical Care, Transport, About
Admin CANNOT see Header tab (correctly hidden)
Admin CANNOT see Footer tab (correctly hidden)
Admin can see and edit Home page content
Admin can see edit buttons for content items
critical_code_review_comments: CMSManager.jsx correctly implements role-based page access using isSuperAdmin check
adminPages array contains 4 pages accessible to all admins
superAdminOnlyPages array contains Header and Footer with superAdminOnly flag
Lock icon correctly displayed on Header/Footer tabs using Lock component from lucide-react
Purple notice banner (bg-purple-50) correctly shown for header/footer sections
data-testid attributes properly implemented for all tabs (page-tab-{id})
seed_data_creation: CMS content already seeded with 24 items including Home (4), Medical Care (4), Transport (4), About (6), Header (2), Footer (4)
context_for_next_testing_agent: CMS role-based access fully tested and working. Super Admin has full access to all 6 page tabs including Header and Footer. Admin has access to 4 page tabs (Home, Medical Care, Transport, About) but NOT Header and Footer. Purple notice banner correctly appears for Super Admin only sections. All content items are properly seeded and displayed.
